ProjectTitle: Dissecting environmental-genome-epigenome interactions during embryonic development using a vitamin C deficiency model
InitialFeedbackHistory:
12/03/2024
As you are generating new data on embryo tissues, I assume you work with the physical embryo samples? Include those physical samples in the data description and throughout the DMP. Will those physical samples be stored and kept? Where and how will they be stored and kept? What is their estimated volume/count? How are they documented?
It's recommended to appoint a Principal Investigator (PI) who will be responsible for both data preservation and sharing, especially considering the possibility of your departure from KU Leuven after the conclusion of your project.
label: good with suggestions
